reference.shortdesc: The state element specifies a name/value pair whenever it is necessary to represent a named state that has a variable value.

section.title: Usage information
section.p: The element is primarily intended for use in specializations to represent specific states. For example, it could be used to represent logic circuit states, chemical reaction states, or airplane instrumentation states.

section.title: Attributes
section.p: The following attributes are available on this element: and the attributes defined below.

dlentry.dd: Specifies the name of the property whose state is being described.
Specifies the state of the property identified by the name attribute.

example.title: Example
example.p: The following code sample shows how state can be used to indicate a "high" value for a flow rate in a device.
example.codeblock: <note type="warning">If the rate of flow reaches "high" on your FancyMeasureDevice (<state name="flowrate" value="high"), take quick action or you will risk dangrous levels of exposure.</note>
